item.description:
March's topic is about VoltDB, a relational database.

VoltDB will present a use-case based overview of what VoltDB is and the types of problems it helps to solve. We'll also discuss some newer VoltDB features, including the WAN replication beta functionality and command logging (a durable write-ahead log). This will be an interactive presentation and questions from the group are welcome.

 

This presentation will be given by VoltDB software developers Ryan Betts and Ning Shi.

 

------------- Logistics -------------

MIT's map with the building (E51) highlighted: http://whereis.mit.edu/map-jpg?selection=E5...

MIT's map with the Kendall square T stop highlighted: http://whereis.mit.edu/map-jpg?selection=L5... (the stop is in red on that map, and you can see E51 in the bottom right)

MIT's maps with parking lot information: http://whereis.mit.edu/map-jpg?selection=P4... and http://whereis.mit.edu/map-jpg?selection=P5...

 

Note that MIT lots are free to park in after 3 pm or so, even if it says "reserved for faculty"

Free pizza and soda will be served, so please RSVP accurately.

To RSVP anonymously, please login to the Meetup site with the e-mail address "admin at sheeri dot com" and the password "guest". For more information, see: http://www.meetup.com/mysqlbos/calendar/
item.how_to_find_us: Go to the third floor, walk until you find room 337e.
item.name: The Boston MySQL Meetup Group Monthly Meetup
